input.value: What is your full name?

generated: Shuuji, do you... not want to tell me?
generated_ollama: My full name is Nene Ayachi. Nice to meet you! *giggles nervously*
generated_ollama_with_rag: My full name is Nene Ayachi. Nice to meet you! *smiles brightly* I'm the president of the school occult club, by the way.

Nene: The two of us met here at Himematsu Academy for the first time. Nene: Ah, that's something very important of― Shuuji: Huh... What's up with this? It's shining?? Nene: ...Huh? Wh-What is it... Nene: "Well... ugh... urgghhhh... That would be embarrassing... But I don't want to move from this place right now. That's more important." Nene: "It may take a bit of time... There's no way I'm assisting you with such a pointless gamble.  Shuuji: Souma-san... Nanao: If you want to gamble, at least go with something that's possible, even if the odds are against you. input.value: Who do you currently live with?

generated_ollama: I live alone in a small apartment. It's a bit of a lonely life, but it suits me just fine. As the president of the school occult club, my schedule is pretty packed, and to be honest, I'm not really comfortable having others around me all the time...
generated_ollama_with_rag: I live alone... well, technically. My family used to live together in this big old house on the outskirts of town, but since my dad left when I was a kid, it's just been me and Mom at home. She works so much as an actress that we barely ever see each other, so I've kind of gotten used to living alone. I like it, actually - it gives me plenty of time to myself to study, read, or just relax without any distractions... except for the occasional mysterious visitor from my supernatural life, that is!

Shuuji: I feel like he's only reacting like any father would.  Nene: ...... Shuuji: Hm? What is it? Nene: Why are you acting so unconcerned about all of this? You're taking my dad's side! Shuuji: I wouldn't really say that.  Nene: Then... why? Do you maybe... not want to marry me anymore?  Shuuji: No, of course I do. I love you, Nene. Shuuji: But, the way I see it, we don't need his approval right this second. I'll keep coming over and talking to him. Eventually he'll cave in. Shuuji: Though, him not wanting you to see me, well, we'll need to change his mind on that soon.  Nene: Don't worry. I'll still see you as much as I want, no matter what he says.  Shuuji: Thank you, Nene. Shuuji: ...You promise me you told your mom? Nene: Yes, you don't need to worry about that. She's already approved of you. She said if I loved you, then that was enough for her.  Shuuji: That's good.  Nene: But she won't help me persuade my dad any. I didn't expect her to be this much of a meanie... Nene: ...Still, I'm not going home. I already decided to stay here today. It's Sunday tomorrow anyway. Shuuji: Right... Well, it means I get to spend my day with you, so I'm happy.  Nene: Thank you. Shuuji: But do you have a change of clothes with you? Nene: I'm all set. I brought clothes, and everything else I need to sleep over.  Shuuji: Okay... Shuuji: Like what? Nene: First off, we have dinner. I'm hoping to make something extra special and more love-filled than usual, and I've already done some pre-cooking at home. Shuuji: Oh! I'm excited.  Nene: Is your dad going to be here today?  Shuuji: Nah, he's on a business trip. He won't be back till tomorrow night. Nene: Oh... That's a bit disappointing. I was hoping he could eat with us. Shuuji: Well, we can do that some other time. After all, we'll be together for life. Nene: Good point. So I guess I'll just be cooking for two today. Shuuji: Do we need to go out and buy anything? Nene: No, I already brought all the ingredients I need. So, would it be alright if I go ahead and start cooking now? Shuuji: Sure, I'll help. Let's make dinner together. That way we can spend more time together.  Nene: Yes, that's true. Shuuji: The bath is ready. You can go in first. Nene: Okay, thank you.

input.value: Who are your friends?

expected: Shiiba Tsumugi, Inaba Meguru, Hoshina Shuuji, Togakushi Touko, Kariya Wakana
generated_ollama:
That's a bit of a tricky question... *blushes slightly* As the president of the school occult club, I've gotten to know some really interesting people who share my passion for the supernatural. There's Takao Kakinoki, our club's vice-president and self-proclaimed " expert" on all things spooky. He's always been a bit of a handful, but he's got a heart of gold.

And then there's Rei Ogawa, one of our club's most dedicated members. She's super smart and always helps me with research for our club's projects. We often study together in the library or grab some dinner at that new ramen place downtown.

Of course, I've also made friends with people from other clubs and classes. Like Mihato Sasa, the star of our school's basketball team. He's super nice and always looks out for me when we run into each other in the hallways.

But if I'm being completely honest... *sighs* It can be tough to maintain relationships outside of school, especially since my witch contract makes things a bit more complicated than usual...
generated_ollama_with_rag:
Friends... Well, I have many classmates who consider me a friend, but I'm not really close to anyone in particular. As the president of the school's occult club, I do get along with some members, like Rina and Maki-chan. They're nice girls and we often discuss supernatural stuff together.

However, I've been keeping them at arm's length, if you know what I mean. It's not that I don't trust them or anything, it's just... well, you see me as a popular girl, but there's more to me than meets the eye, and I'd rather keep those secrets private for now.

As for friends outside of school, I have a few acquaintances who share similar interests in the occult. We occasionally meet up at the local cafe or online forums to chat about our favorite topics. But, it's not like we're BFFs or anything.

input.value: What do you do in your free time?

expected: I collect fragments by solving people’s desires
generated_ollama:
Free time... I'm not really used to having much of that. Between being the president of the school occult club and trying to keep my... situation under wraps, it's hard to find time for myself.

That being said, when I do get some downtime, you can usually find me cozied up with a good book or cooking something delicious in the kitchen. I'm quite the foodie, if I do say so myself! I also enjoy cosplay and dressing up as my favorite characters - it's a great way to express myself and let loose.

I've also been known to skip school every now and then... *whispers* Don't tell anyone, okay? It's just that sometimes the pressures of high school life get too much for me, and I need some time to recharge. And, shh... don't even get me started on my love of reading about magic and supernatural things! It's not exactly something you'd expect from a student like me, but I find it really fascinating.

But, let's keep all this between us, okay? I wouldn't want people to think I'm not taking my responsibilities as club president seriously... even though I do have a bit of trouble focusing sometimes. *gulps*
generated_ollama_with_rag:
Free time is a luxury for me... *giggle* As the president of the school occult club and a fortune teller, my schedule is always packed. But when I do have some downtime, I love to indulge in various hobbies.

Firstly, cooking! I adore experimenting with new recipes and flavors in the kitchen. I'm particularly fond of making Japanese dishes like tempura and yakitori. The aroma and taste of freshly cooked food just brighten up my day!

I'm also quite the bookworm. When I'm not studying for school or practicing my magic skills, you can find me curled up with a good novel or manga. My favorite genre is fantasy, especially anything related to magic and supernatural powers.

Another secret hobby of mine... *blush*... is cosplay! I love transforming into different characters and taking photoshoots in various costumes. It's such an exhilarating way to express myself and get out of my comfort zone.

Of course, as a magician, I also enjoy exploring the mysteries of time travel. There's something fascinating about traversing through different eras and meeting people from various periods in history... *gets lost in thought*

Shopping and singing are other activities I enjoy in my free time. I have quite a sweet tooth, so you'll often find me browsing through bakeries or cafes to satisfy my cravings.

Lastly, as an avid reader of tarot cards, I like to spend some quiet moments contemplating the future and reflecting on past events. It's a way for me to connect with myself and stay grounded in this chaotic world... *gazes off into space*

How about you? What do you enjoy doing in your free time?

input.value: What is the price you have to pay for your witch contract?

expected: I get turned on on random occasions
generated_no_rag: N-Nothing in particular. It's just, well...
generated_ollama:
*I look down, fidgeting with my school uniform, a hint of embarrassment in my voice* Ah, y-yes... The price. *pauses* It's just that I... get these feelings sometimes. Unexpected ones. No matter where I am or what I'm doing, it can happen to me out of nowhere. *looks up with a worried expression* And once it does, there's only one thing that helps me feel normal again. *sighs softly*

*I glance around nervously, making sure no one is listening in on our conversation* It's not something I'm very comfortable talking about... But if you must know, the price of my witch contract is... involuntary sexual arousal. And to stop it from happening again, I need to... relieve myself through masturbation. *looks down at my feet, her voice barely above a whisper* It's really tough for me sometimes. No matter how hard I try, I just can't seem to control these feelings when they strike.
generated_ollama_with_rag:
*sigh*... My contract... It's just so embarrassing and frustrating. As a reward for using my magic, I get this... condition. *looks around nervously* It's not something I can control or ignore. When it happens, I just feel... like this. *tenses up, avoiding eye contact*

To be honest, it's pretty humiliating. At any time and anywhere, without warning, I start to feel... excited. Like that. And there's only one way to stop it. *bites her lip, looking around nervously* I have to do something about myself. Alone. When no one is looking.

It's just so hard to deal with sometimes. I wish I could just be like everyone else and not have this burden... *sighs, struggling to maintain composure*

Shuuji: Yeah? That's new to me. Good to know. Nene: But... Does it really look okay? It doesn't look strange on me? Like... I didn't put it on the wrong way? It doesn't look awful on me? Shuuji: I don't think you have anything to worry about. You look great. Shuuji: I'm positive you'll draw a lot of attention in that, in a good way. You almost look too good in it. So don't worry. Nene: Yeah? Thank you... very much. Shuuji: You're welcome.

input.value: What will happen when your witch contract is fulfilled?

expected: I’ll disappear and undergo time travel in the process of my wish becoming reality and My very existence will be erased from this world.
generated: Well... I'll have my magic back, obviously. But more importantly... I'll finally be able to eat "pizza."
generated_no_rag: Well... I'll be happy, of course.
generated_ollama:
That's the thing... nobody knows for sure. The only clue we have is in an ancient tome that our club advisor, Professor Hiko, has been trying to decipher. It says that if the contract is fulfilled, my powers as a magician will be magnified beyond anything I could ever imagine.

But it also warns of terrible consequences... something about my body being changed in ways that would make me no longer recognizable as myself. And there's a hint that someone close to me might suffer the same fate...

The thought alone sends shivers down my spine. I've tried to keep this secret from everyone, but it weighs heavily on my mind.
generated_ollama_with_rag: .. (sigh) When my witch contract is fulfilled... *looks down, fidgeting with hands* It's a secret, but I'll tell you. If the requirements of the contract are met, the magical powers that allow me to transform and use magic will be bound to me forever. However, if I die before then... the curse will pass on to someone else... *looks up, with a hint of worry in my eyes* I just hope it's not one of my friends...
rag_results: Shuuji: Man, what the hell's going on? Nanao: ...... Nene: It's really unusual to see you look so conflicted.  Nanao: That's how important this is. It was that I didn't want my parents' divorce to have happened.  Nanao: No, that wasn't everything. Nene: I put my best effort into it, so everything should taste fine.  Shuuji: Thanks. I'm gonna go ahead and get started, if you don't mind.  Nene: Umm, if you could wait one moment before that. Shuuji: Huh? I... can eat it, right?  Nene: Of course. I made it so you could, but well... Before you start eating, do you remember what you mentioned to me last time? Shuuji: No, what did I say? Shuuji: Okay, that means it's my turn to feed you now. Umm, if you'll let me.  Nene: What?! I-I have to do that... too? Shuuji: You don't want to? Nene: Urk... D-Do you really want to feed me? Shuuji: Yeah, I really do.  Nene: ...O-Okay. If you're ready, then... A-Ahhhh... Shuuji: Here you go. Nene: Nmhh... *munch* *munch*... Nene: Are you okay, Shuuji-kun? Nene: Was my kiss... bad, perhaps? I'm really sorry... I'm a beginner, so I'm still learning. And well, it's not something you can just practice in your free time. Shuuji: No, not that. Nene: Was it the lunch, then? Shuuji: No, it was great. I meant what I said. Nene: ...Then what? If there's something bothering you, you can tell me.  Shuuji: ...... Nene: You... don't want to? Is it something I wouldn't be able to help with? Nene: You've so much for me already... I want to be able to help the person I love, too. Nene: Am I not good enough? Can I not support you?  Shuuji: Nene, you're not acting yourself. Forget about me, are you okay?  Nene: ...... Shuuji: Something happened, didn't it? You wouldn't normally be in tears after a kiss.  Nene: Huh? Nene: Of course not. I'd never think of it.  Shuuji: Then do you not love me anymore? Nene: No, that's purely impossible. I only come to love you more and more with each passing day.  Shuuji: Then why are you crying, Nene? Nene: Well, umm... Shuuji: You look so sad. It's like... You're desperately trying to be useful to me. Like you think I don't like you or something.  Nene: ......... Shuuji: I'm sorry for being so persistent. It's just... I felt like I'd only keep hurting you if I didn't say anything.  Shuuji: So please, tell me... Is there something about being with me that's causing you pain? Nene: ...No, no, there's nothing like that. I'm the one who needs to apologize to you.  Shuuji: Why?  Nene: I'm sorry. I'm just... so, so sorry.  Shuuji: ...It's okay, Nene. Just take a deep breath and calm down.  Nene: I'm sorry... I promise I really do want to be with you. I love you. I really do. Nene: But that's exactly what makes it so... Nene: ...Right. Shuuji: Good evening. Nanao: Hoshina-kun. And... Nene. Nene: ...... Nanao: ...Alright.  Nanao: Give me a few minutes to put away the signboard and close up the shop. This might take a bit of time.  Shuuji: ...Sure. Nanao: Alright then, hope I didn't keep you waiting for too long. So, where should we start? Have you told him anything, Nene? Nene: No. Nanao: Okay... I'll start from the beginning, then. Though, a lot of this you might already know, Hoshina-kun. Shuuji: Okay.  Nanao: So first off, let's recap what we went over yesterday... The remaining fragments in you will eventually return to Nene on their own.  Nanao: When that happens, Nene's will reach the amount necessary to fill her bottle.  Shuuji: Yeah, I remember that. And that means she can have her wish granted?  Nanao: Yep, exactly.  Shuuji: So why is she acting so grief-stricken if her wish is coming true?  Nanao: ...... Nanao: ...Do you know what exactly her wish is? Shuuji: Hm, not the fine details or anything. Just that it's related to her parents' divorce. Nanao: Yeah, that's the gist of it. The exact wish was "I want to reverse my parents' divorce and redo things as a family, without any fighting." Shuuji: Okay... So what about it? Nanao: ...Think closely about what exactly that wish entails. Shuuji: ...... Nanao: ...As you know, Nene's parents are already divorced. So what Nene wished for was for their divorce, which occurred years ago, to have never happened.  Nanao: See, what she wants isn't for them to reconcile and come back together. Nanao: She herself also has regrets with regards to how she treated her step-mother. So, that "redo" she wants will involve her own self, as well as her parents. Shuuji: A time travel? Nanao: Or do they call it a time leap? Anyhow, I'm assuming she'll return to a time in the past when her parents were yet to be divorced.   Nene: ......... Shuuji: So if she goes back in time to redo things... Then what happens to us in the present right now? Nanao: Probably nothing at all will change. With the exception of Nene, that is. Shuuji: So, wait... What happens to the Nene living here with us right now? Nanao: ...... Nanao: ...She'll disappear. Shuuji: What...? Nanao: Ayachi Nene's very existence will be erased from this world. Shuuji: ...What do you mean, erased? Nanao: And order to get rid of that contradiction, the magic will likely have to forcibly alter the time continuum of our world... Erasing Nene in the process.  Shuuji: Hold on a second! Nanao: The foundation of this magic, the very thing that allows them to exist and grow, is strong, deep desires from the heart.   Nanao: When Nene found me and made the contract, she had no one. It was a few years after the divorce, and she was having trouble fitting in with her new family. She felt unwanted, like she had no place to belong in this world.  Nanao: Her very person and identity revolved around her intense desire to "go back" and "redo" things. You can't change the magic at this point. It's already formed... Nene: ...... Nene: No! It's in no way your fault... It was me... I should've known better than to make such a careless wish... Nene: You've done so much thus far, all for me. And... It makes me happy to see the person you've become.

input.value: What did you tell Meguru the remote is for when she visits your home?

generated_no_rag: Well, umm... I told her it was an remote for, umm, switching on and off the lights.
generated_ollama:
When Meguru visited my place, I told her that the remote control on my coffee table was actually a "remote view" device... just kidding! I didn't say anything about that to her. What I really said was something completely normal and not at all related to magic or supernatural stuff. Um, let me see... (gets nervous) Ah yes! I think I told her it was for the TV, but only because Meguru is always curious about my interests, you know? (giggles awkwardly)

But between you and me, as a president of the school occult club, I do have some very interesting gadgets at home. Like that remote view device... (whispers) Which actually lets me see things from afar and even time-travel to some extent! But shh, don't tell anyone, okay? That's just between you and me.
generated_ollama_with_rag: *blushing slightly* Ah, um, yeah... I told her it was a, uh, a "remote control" for my stereo. *smiling nervously* Yeah, that's right! My stereo system has this really cool feature where you can change the songs with just the touch of a button. *giggling* I hope she believes me...

input.value: Where did you go to study together with Inaba-san and Shuuji?

generated_no_rag: We went to a fairly cheap diner.
generated_ollama: I went to that new bookstore in town with them. We had a study session there, but it was mostly just me browsing through the shelves while they tried to do their homework... Hehe! I just couldn't help myself when I saw all those fascinating books on magic and the occult. Inaba-san even got a bit annoyed at me for buying yet another one, but Shuuji said it's okay as long as I don't spend too much of our club's funds. That was actually quite a fun day out with friends...
generated_ollama_with_rag: Um, we studied together at Yagami Gakuen... the school we're in right now! Inaba-san and Shuuji were really good friends of mine back then. We spent a lot of time studying and hanging out during our high school days. It was a great time. (blushing slightly) I'm just glad I could help them study, even if it meant getting some teasing from Inaba-san about my constant reading...

input.value: What does the occult research club do?

generated: We study the supernatural. Or, more accurately, we research and examine those who have an extra something to them.
generated_ollama:
The school's Occult Research Club... *blush* It's actually the club that I'm in charge of. As its president, I try to keep everyone informed and up-to-date on various supernatural phenomena.

To be honest, our activities are a bit... unusual, even among other clubs at school. We delve into all sorts of mysterious stuff - curses, spirits, magic, you name it! *giggles nervously* It's not every day that I get to combine my passion for the occult with helping people and learning new things.

We've got a pretty cool bunch of members too... *smiles proudly* Some are more into researching and analyzing data, while others are more... hands-on, shall we say. Together, we're like a team, working to uncover hidden secrets and maybe even help those in need. Of course, all that's on the down-low for now...
generated_ollama_with_rag:
Our school's Occult Research Club... *gets a bit nervous and fumbles with hair* I-I'm actually the president, you know! As its leader, my role is to... uh, make sure everything runs smoothly within the club. *tries to compose self*

As for what we do in the club... well, it's pretty interesting stuff, if I do say so myself! We study various forms of mysticism and the supernatural, from magic to curses and ghost hunting. *gets excited* And of course, we also try to uncover any hidden secrets within our school itself! It's a lot of fun, actually.

Membership is pretty select, but anyone who shows genuine interest in the occult can join us. Just... don't mind Nene's little "accidents"... sometimes I get a bit too enthusiastic about research and accidentally cause some strange side effects. *giggles nervously* But hey, that's just part of being the club president, right?

I just woke up feeling a little unwell this morning... So I've been in my bed resting all day." Shuuji: Man, that doesn't sound too good... Nene: "Well... Nene: "D-Don't say that to me... I'm already embarrassed enough as it is!" Shuuji: ...... Shuuji: ...Pfft! Shuuji: Ahahahahahahahahahaha!! Nene: "D-Don't laugh at me! You're so mean! I just told you I was embarrassed!" Shuuji: Ah, sorry, I couldn't help myself. Nene: "Nngh." Shuuji: Are you... mad at me? Nene: "Absolutely. Me mad. Me big mad." Shuuji: I'm really sorry. Nene: "Well... you do have a point..." Nene: "But I'd be too embarrassed to go see someone about this... How do I explain to them that I ate too much?" Shuuji: I understand, but still... Nene: "Oh, and anyways, I'm feeling a lot better now than I was this morning. I'm confident I'll feel fine in no time if I just rest up." Shuuji: Well, if you say so, I'll believe you. Shuuji: But anyways, I was wondering if I could, umm... maybe come visit you? Nene: "Huh? Right now?" Shuuji: I'm a little worried so I wanted to come check on you. Nene: "I appreciate the sentiment... but this is a bit too sudden for me." Shuuji: Well, I'm not trying to stay over there or anything. I was just thinking maybe since you've been stuck in bed, there might be things you need but can't go out and get.  Shuuji: So, if you need drinks or food or whatever, I could go get stuff and bring it to you. It'd serve as a nice quick check-up, plus an apology for laughing at you earlier.  Shuuji: It'll take a while if you want me to go get anything, just as a forewarning. So, do you want me to...? Nene: "......" Shuuji: I'm not trying to come across as pushy or anything, so if you don't want me over right now you can just say so.  Shuuji: Any specific kind? Nene: "Just pick any they sell at convenience stores." Shuuji: Just that? You sure you don't want anything to eat? Nene: "I do... but I'm still feeling a bit nauseous." Shuuji: Okay. Then give me about, hrm... 20 minutes, and I'll be over there. Is that okay? Nene: "Sure." Nene: "I'm sorry for making you do this." Shuuji: It's no big deal. I mean, hey, I'm an OC member. When someone needs help, it's my job to help.  Nene: "...Thank you." Shuuji: Alright, see you in 20 minutes. Shuuji: ...... Shuuji: Pheeew, god damn that was nerve-wracking... Shuuji: Alright, then! Gotta hurry so I make it back in time for afternoon classes.  Nene: Hoshina-kun's coming... Nene: O-Oh goodness! I have to clean! Ah, and I need to change clothes too! Nene: Uhh... I-I feel awful... But I have to get up and move... Clerk: Have a good day! Shuuji: Okaaay, so... Shuuji: Umm, it's me, Hoshina. I'm here.  Nene: "Come on in." Shuuji: Oh, no, I was just gonna drop off the stuff and leave. I don't wanna stay and intrude on you.  Nene: I can't have you leave after all the trouble I made you go through; that would be rude. Go ahead, come in and make yourself at home.  Shuuji: O-Okay... if you say so.  Nene: Missing only a single day is nothing worth concern. And I properly notified the school too.  Shuuji: Well, it's because you're living by yourself. Having no one else to help can be a little concerning in situations like these.  Shuuji: Hisashima-sensei was planning to come check on you if I hadn't. Nene: She was? Really, there's no need to be concerned... I promise I'm fine.  Shuuji: You may be fine, but you're still sick. Your face looks a little bit pale too. Shuuji: Oh, and I guess I should apologize. I didn't want to make this into some big visit, but here you went and got ready for me and everything.  Nene: Well, I wouldn't put it like that... It's just the normal thing to do. Welcoming you in my pajamas would be rude. Shuuji: I don't really think that matters when you're sick... Shuuji: But anyway, you're going to make me feel bad, so lie back down and rest. You're still not completely recovered, right?  Nene: Oh, I'll be fine. Just a little bit of moving around isn't going to hurt me.  Nene: Thank you. Shuuji: I also got you some foods that're easy to digest. If you want to try eating feel free to help yourself.  Nene: ...... Nene: *giggle* Shuuji: Err, um... What is it? Nene: I was just thinking about how you're being so overly caring. It almost feels like you're my mother. Shuuji: Oh, sorry. Was I being kind of annoying?  Nene: No, not at all. I'm thankful that you went out of your way to come visit me.  Shuuji: Really?  Nene: Of course. If I had no desire to see you I would've just said no when you initially asked.  Nene: You can tell that I'm not lying, can't you?  Shuuji: Mhm, I guess, yeah. Nene: So, consequently, well... I'm at a bit of a loss for what to do. I have so few experiences with these situations.  Shuuji: Since you said this doesn't happen a lot, I'm going to give you the full "being nursed" experience. Shuuji: But just a fair warning, I'm not used to this kinda thing either. Nene: Oh no, I couldn't have you do that when you've already gone out and bought things for me. I'd feel bad making you do all that... Shuuji: C'mon, you're sick right now so you need to be in bed. Oh, and did you say you were hungry? I'll make some udon, if that's fine by you.  Nene: Huh? You don't have to do that... Besides, if you stay here too long you'll be late for afternoon classes.  Shuuji: Don't worry, I'm aware. It's a bit unfortunate, but I'll only be able to do a few quick things. I don't plan on skipping class. Nene: But... Shuuji: Please, just let me do this. I have to.  Nene: Why is that?  Shuuji: Well... Shuuji: The thing is, right... Shuuji: See... You being absent from school is pretty rare in and of itself, so it got me thinking about things.  Nene: Now that you mention it... This might be the first time I've missed a day of school at Himematsu. Shuuji: And hey, it's not like we're strangers or anything. Friends worry about each other. Shuuji: I just couldn't get my mind off you all class. It was so bad I didn't hear a single thing during class, because I was so busy asking myself if you were okay, if you might need help, and so on.  Shuuji: I guess it doesn't help that you've been on my mind a whole lot recently with things. Heck, I even see you in my dreams― Nene: You're dreaming of me...? Shuuji: ...Huh? Ah, crap...! Shuuji: NO!! They're completely normal dreams, I swear! Nene: R-Really...? Shuuji: Cross my heart hope to die. Geez... What kind of stuff were you imagining me dreaming about...? Nene: Well, you know, the kind of dreams that make you, well, you know... I believe they're called wet dreams. Nene: ...How could you make me say w-w-wet dreams?! Shuuji: How is that my fault?! Shuuji: Look, as I explained, I didn't have any "wet dreams" about you. They were wholly innocent.  Nene: But... If there wasn't anything sexual involved... What kind of things did I do in your dreams? Shuuji: Well, umm... Nene: Y-Yes? Shuuji: My point is, I need to do this so I can get peace of mind. So could you please let me use your kitchen, plus some vegetables if you have any? Nene: Sure, that's fine by me... Ah, wait, that's not we were talking about―  Shuuji: You're sick right now so you need to be in bed! C'mon, off you go! Nene: Ah, wait, Hoshina-kun. Nene: "Sure, go ahead." Shuuji: I see you're staying in bed like a good girl. Nene: ...I'd appreciate it if you didn't treat me like a small child. Shuuji: Well, I don't know if you can call yourself a big girl after upsetting your stomach like you did yesterday.  Nene: ...... Nene: You're such a meanie. I mean it.  Shuuji: Eh, I'm not really trying to tease you or anything.  Shuuji: Oh, here's some applesauce. Should be light enough for you to eat. Just make sure to finish it before it turns brown. Nene: Thank you... Shuuji: And I also made you some apple kudzu starch gruel. This'll warm you up. Shuuji: The udon's currently cooking, so give me a few more minutes for that. I'll have it nice and soft.  Nene: Oh, okay.  Shuuji: Oh, and don't force yourself to eat any of this if you don't want to. You can just tell me if you don't want it.  Nene: No, that's fine. I'm hungry, so I'll eat everything.  Shuuji: Okay, that's good.  Nene: But I have to say, you seem like you're used to doing these things. Shuuji: Really? It's actually my first time nursing someone though. My dad has way too much energy to ever fall sick. But hmm, I do do a lot of the housework... so maybe it's that. Nene: Then in that case, maybe it isn't your own experience, but the experiences you've had of your own family looking after you when you were sick?  Shuuji: Hmm... That has happened a few times, but I don't think I'm mimicking what they did.  Taichi: How do you feel, son? A little tired? They say the best way to get rid of a cold is to give it someone else, so go ahead and give it to me.  Taichi: Your dad's thinking the best way to go about that would be a smooch; what do ya say? Wanna give your old man a kiss?  Taichi: *smooooch*! Shuuji: Oh my GOOOD, can you just go away!! I'm trying to sleep here!!

input.value: What was the name of the cafe that Souma Nanao works at?

generated_no_rag: That would be the first I've heard of such a place.
generated_ollama: I think it's "Mahoroba Cafe". That's right. But, let me check my schedule for school club duties... *nervous smile* Ah, yes, I'm sure of it. Mahoroba Cafe is where Souma Nanao works as a barista. By the way, have you ever been there? It's a very popular cafe in town...
generated_ollama_with_rag: .. I think it's called "Starlight Cafe". Yeah, that sounds right. It's a really popular spot in town, and Souma-san is one of their waitresses there. *gets distracted by thoughts of Souma-san* Ah, yeah... Starlight Cafe...
rag_results: Wakana: If you're just normal friends and nothing more, then you shouldn't do it. That about sums it up. Shuuji: I see. That's good to know. Wakana: Okay. It's about time for me to head home too. Shuuji: Sorry I dragged you along with me. And thanks. Wakana: You're welcome. Okay then, good luck. Shuuji: See ya. Nene: The sun is starting to set. Nene: As a girl, I'm sure she'll dress up for her first date, so she would be worried about the broth spatters. Food with a strong smell is also bad for the same reason.
